text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Crown prosecution service starts inspection on Supreme Court special division
- Lopera forbids Canal Sur cameras at Betis-Rayo
- Wislawa Szymborska: "Surprise is an important category in life"
EL MUNDO
- Judge discovers that Galindo's assets substantially exceed what he has declared
- Belgium mobilises against failure of its institutions
DIARIO 16
- Pujol allies with PNV over ETA prisoners
ABC
- The pressure on ETA with the arrest of "Pototo" forces the mafia bank to diminish the activity of its commanders
- Gonzalez doesn't dare participate in budget debate
CINCO DIAS
- A crisis as big as a truck -- The price of gasoline and the reduction of margins puts truck freight in hard times.
- The PP government imposes electric model designed by Fuster and initiated by PSOE
- Repsol will invest 66 billion pesetas in Egypt
EXPANSION
- Government will buy majority of electric network from sector businesses
- European commission opposes reduction in VAT on toll highways
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
-Hidrocantabrico studies purchase of Viesgo from Endesa
- Patrimonio earned 275 billion pesetas in 1995 thanks to Telefonica and Argentaria
- BBV will use its assets in Latin America to enter U.S.
- "The regional financing scheme can create fiscal paradises"
